_88autoload.description: Description of how the package can be autoloaded.

___exclude-from-classmap.description: This is an array of patterns to exclude from autoload classmap generation. (e.g. "exclude-from-classmap": ["/test/", "/tests/", "/Tests/"]

___files.description: This is an array of files that are always required on every request.

___classmap.description: This is an array of directories that contain classes to be included in the class-map generation process.

___psr-4.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the PSR-4 directories they can map to (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

___psr-0.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the directories they can be found in (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

_88authors.description: List of authors that contributed to the package. This is typically the main maintainers, not the full list.

$eref.description: Description of how the package can be autoloaded.

___exclude-from-classmap.description: This is an array of patterns to exclude from autoload classmap generation. (e.g. "exclude-from-classmap": ["/test/", "/tests/", "/Tests/"]

___files.description: This is an array of files that are always required on every request.

___classmap.description: This is an array of directories that contain classes to be included in the class-map generation process.

___psr-4.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the PSR-4 directories they can map to (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

___psr-0.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the directories they can be found in (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

$eref.description: List of authors that contributed to the package. This is typically the main maintainers, not the full list.

___include-path.description: DEPRECATED: A list of directories which should get added to PHP's include path. This is only present to support legacy projects, and all new code should preferably use autoloading.

___target-dir.description: DEPRECATED: Forces the package to be installed into the given subdirectory path. This is used for autoloading PSR-0 packages that do not contain their full path. Use forward slashes for cross-platform compatibility.

___bin.description: A set of files, or a single file, that should be treated as binaries and symlinked into bin-dir (from config).

___include-path.description: DEPRECATED: A list of directories which should get added to PHP's include path. This is only present to support legacy projects, and all new code should preferably use autoloading.

___target-dir.description: DEPRECATED: Forces the package to be installed into the given subdirectory path. This is used for autoloading PSR-0 packages that do not contain their full path. Use forward slashes for cross-platform compatibility.

___bin.description: A set of files, or a single file, that should be treated as binaries and symlinked into bin-dir (from config).

___include-path.description: DEPRECATED: A list of directories which should get added to PHP's include path. This is only present to support legacy projects, and all new code should preferably use autoloading.

___target-dir.description: DEPRECATED: Forces the package to be installed into the given subdirectory path. This is used for autoloading PSR-0 packages that do not contain their full path. Use forward slashes for cross-platform compatibility.

___bin.description: A set of files, or a single file, that should be treated as binaries and symlinked into bin-dir (from config).

___suggest.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and descriptions (values) that this package suggests work well with it (this will be suggested to the user during installation).

___require.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that are required to run this package.

___license.description: License name. Or an array of license names.

___type.description: Package type, either 'library' for common packages, 'composer-plugin' for plugins, 'metapackage' for empty packages, or a custom type ([a-z0-9-]+) defined by whatever project this package applies to.

$eref.description: Description of how the package can be autoloaded.

___exclude-from-classmap.description: This is an array of patterns to exclude from autoload classmap generation. (e.g. "exclude-from-classmap": ["/test/", "/tests/", "/Tests/"]

___files.description: This is an array of files that are always required on every request.

___classmap.description: This is an array of directories that contain classes to be included in the class-map generation process.

___psr-4.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the PSR-4 directories they can map to (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

___psr-0.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the directories they can be found in (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

$eref.description: List of authors that contributed to the package. This is typically the main maintainers, not the full list.

___minimum-stability.description: The minimum stability the packages must have to be install-able. Possible values are: dev, alpha, beta, RC, stable.

___readme.description: Relative path to the readme document.

___include-path.description: DEPRECATED: A list of directories which should get added to PHP's include path. This is only present to support legacy projects, and all new code should preferably use autoloading.

___provide.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that this package provides in addition to this package's name.

___target-dir.description: DEPRECATED: Forces the package to be installed into the given subdirectory path. This is used for autoloading PSR-0 packages that do not contain their full path. Use forward slashes for cross-platform compatibility.

___autoload-dev.description: Description of additional autoload rules for development purpose (eg. a test suite).

___files.description: This is an array of files that are always required on every request.

___classmap.description: This is an array of directories that contain classes to be included in the class-map generation process.

___psr-4.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the PSR-4 directories they can map to (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

___psr-0.description: This is a hash of namespaces (keys) and the directories they can be found into (values, can be arrays of paths) by the autoloader.

___extra.description: Arbitrary extra data that can be used by plugins, for example, package of type composer-plugin may have a 'class' key defining an installer class name.

___version.description: Package version, see https://getcomposer.org/doc/04-schema.md#version for more info on valid schemes.

___non-feature-branches.description: A set of string or regex patterns for non-numeric branch names that will not be handled as feature branches.

___irc.description: IRC channel for support, as irc://server/channel.

___source.description: URL to browse or download the sources.

items.description: A tag/keyword that this package relates to.

___conflict.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that conflict with this package.

___scripts.description: Script listeners that will be executed before/after some events.

___pre-package-uninstall.description: Occurs before a package has been uninstalled, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-create-project-cmd.description: Occurs after the create-project command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-package-update.description: Occurs after a package is updated, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-package-uninstall.description: Occurs after a package has been uninstalled, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-update-cmd.description: Occurs after the update command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-package-install.description: Occurs before a package is installed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-root-package-install.description: Occurs after the root-package is installed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-autoload-dump.description: Occurs after the autoloader is dumped, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-package-install.description: Occurs after a package is installed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-status-cmd.description: Occurs before the status command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-install-cmd.description: Occurs before the install command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-update-cmd.description: Occurs before the update command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-status-cmd.description: Occurs after the status command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-autoload-dump.description: Occurs before the autoloader is dumped, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___pre-package-update.description: Occurs before a package is updated, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___post-install-cmd.description: Occurs after the install command is executed, contains one or more Class::method callables or shell commands.

___bin-dir.description: The location where all binaries are linked, defaults to "vendor/bin".

___cafile.description: A way to set the path to the openssl CA file. In PHP 5.6+ you should rather set this via openssl.cafile in php.ini, although PHP 5.6+ should be able to detect your system CA file automatically.

___disable-tls.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to true all HTTPS URLs will be tried with HTTP instead and no network level encryption is performed. Enabling this is a security risk and is NOT recommended. The better way is to enable the php_openssl extension in php.ini.

___secure-http.description: Defaults to `true`. If set to true only HTTPS URLs are allowed to be downloaded via Composer. If you really absolutely need HTTP access to something then you can disable it, but using "Let's Encrypt" to get a free SSL certificate is generally a better alternative.

___password.description: The password used for HTTP Basic authentication

___username.description: The username used for HTTP Basic authentication

___gitlab-oauth.description: A hash of domain name => gitlab API oauth tokens, typically {"gitlab.com":"<token>"}.

___github-protocols.description: A list of protocols to use for github.com clones, in priority order, defaults to ["git", "https", "http"].

___preferred-install.description: The install method Composer will prefer to use, defaults to auto and can be any of source, dist, auto, or a hash of {"pattern": "preference"}.

___optimize-autoloader.description: Always optimize when dumping the autoloader.

___archive-format.description: The default archiving format when not provided on cli, defaults to "tar".

___cache-vcs-dir.description: The location where vcs infos (git clones, github api calls, etc. when reading vcs repos) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/vcs".

___github-domains.description: A list of domains to use in github mode. This is used for GitHub Enterprise setups, defaults to ["github.com"].

___autoloader-suffix.description: Optional string to be used as a suffix for the generated Composer autoloader. When null a random one will be generated.

___bin-compat.description: The compatibility of the binaries, defaults to "auto" (automatically guessed) and can be "full" (compatible with both Windows and Unix-based systems).

___cache-repo-dir.description: The location where repo (git/hg repo clones) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/repo".

___cache-dir.description: The location where all caches are located, defaults to "~/.composer/cache" on *nix and "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Composer" on windows.

___apcu-autoloader.description: If true, the Composer autoloader will check for APCu and use it to cache found/not-found classes when the extension is enabled, defaults to false.

___cache-files-ttl.description: The cache time-to-live for files, defaults to the value of cache-ttl.

___use-include-path.description: If true, the Composer autoloader will also look for classes in the PHP include path.

___capath.description: If cafile is not specified or if the certificate is not found there, the directory pointed to by capath is searched for a suitable certificate. capath must be a correctly hashed certificate directory.

___prepend-autoloader.description: If false, the composer autoloader will not be prepended to existing autoloaders, defaults to true.

___use-github-api.description: Defaults to true.  If set to false, globally disables the use of the GitHub API for all GitHub repositories and clones the repository as it would for any other repository.

___cache-files-dir.description: The location where files (zip downloads) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/files".

___github-expose-hostname.description: Defaults to true. If set to false, the OAuth tokens created to access the github API will have a date instead of the machine hostname.

___classmap-authoritative.description: If true, the composer autoloader will not scan the filesystem for classes that are not found in the class map, defaults to false.

___process-timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for process executions, defaults to 300 (5mins).

___htaccess-protect.description: Defaults to true. If set to false, Composer will not create .htaccess files in the composer home, cache, and data directories.

___gitlab-domains.description: A list of domains to use in gitlab mode. This is used for custom GitLab setups, defaults to ["gitlab.com"].

___cache-files-maxsize.description: The cache max size for the files cache, defaults to "300MiB".

___platform.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version (values) that will be used to mock the platform packages on this machine.

___discard-changes.description: The default style of handling dirty updates, defaults to false and can be any of true, false or "stash".

___archive-dir.description: The default archive path when not provided on cli, defaults to ".".

___sort-packages.description: Defaults to false. If set to true, Composer will sort packages when adding/updating a new dependency.

___github-oauth.description: A hash of domain name => github API oauth tokens, typically {"github.com":"<token>"}.

___cache-ttl.description: The default cache time-to-live, defaults to 15552000 (6 months).

___gitlab-token.description: A hash of domain name => gitlab private tokens, typically {"gitlab.com":"<token>"}.

___store-auths.description: What to do after prompting for authentication, one of: true (store), false (do not store) or "prompt" (ask every time), defaults to prompt.

___notify-on-install.description: Composer allows repositories to define a notification URL, so that they get notified whenever a package from that repository is installed. This option allows you to disable that behaviour, defaults to true.

___data-dir.description: The location where old phar files are stored, defaults to "$home" except on XDG Base Directory compliant unixes.

___vendor-dir.description: The location where all packages are installed, defaults to "vendor".

____comment.description: A key to store comments in

___abandoned.description: Indicates whether this package has been abandoned, it can be boolean or a package name/URL pointing to a recommended alternative. Defaults to false.

___replace.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that can be replaced by this package.

___prefer-stable.description: If set to true, stable packages will be preferred to dev packages when possible, even if the minimum-stability allows unstable packages.

___bin.description: A set of files, or a single file, that should be treated as binaries and symlinked into bin-dir (from config).

___require-dev.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that this package requires for developing it (testing tools and such).

___repositories.description: A set of additional repositories where packages can be found.

___time.description: Package release date, in 'YYYY-MM-DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' or 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ' format.

___scripts-descriptions.description: Descriptions for custom commands, shown in console help.

___archive.description: Options for creating package archives for distribution.

___exclude.description: A list of patterns for paths to exclude or include if prefixed with an exclamation mark.
